comments.commentBody: I think a reply with historical perspective should be introduced here, Paula. If people were screaming  "do something" in response to the 9/11 attacks, which I assume you were referring to, Saddam Hussein had nothing, nothing to do with that attack on America. In fact, the 9/11 attacks were a distraction from a well-calculated plan by neocons and religious right leaders who had already set their sights on Iraq and impose western values to that entire region.  They first had to address those (Saudis) who perpetrated those attacks by invading Afghanistan and deliberately conflated the 9/11 attacks with the invasion they were planning all along for Iraq. George W. Bush's response in Iraq was not a 'knee jerk' response but a well planned invasion that had catastrophically disastrous  consequences.  It created the world we see today.

I think a reply with historical perspective should be introduced here, Paula. If people were screaming  "do something" in response to the 9/11 attacks, which I assume you were referring to, Saddam Hussein had nothing, nothing to do with that attack on America. In fact, the 9/11 attacks were a distraction from a well-calculated plan by neocons and religious right leaders who had already set their sights on Iraq and impose western values to that entire region.  They first had to address those (Saudis) who perpetrated those attacks by invading Afghanistan and deliberately conflated the 9/11 attacks with the invasion they were planning all along for Iraq. George W. Bush's response in Iraq was not a 'knee jerk' response but a well planned invasion that had catastrophically disastrous  consequences.  It created the world we see today.

This is so tragic. My condolences to all the innocent people who were harmed or lost a loved one today.

I do think there should be room to talk about causes and ways to prevent this, but please let's be level-headed and non-ideological about this. Everyone in their right mind wants to prevent this. Obviously, the availability of assault weapons will tend to facilitate massacres by mad men. Obviously, there are other ways to commit heinous crimes that don't involve assault weapons. Obviously, the majority of Muslims abhor these atrocities. Obviously, it is no coincidence that these suicidal mad men tend to be Muslim. Something is wrong in those communities. Obviously, we need to condemn these murders and act swiftly and harshly to persecute anyone who abetted these murderers and knew about their intentions without alerting the authorities. Obviously, Western nations need to come down harsher on the hateful imams sponsored by Saudi Arabia. Obviously, saying we're at war with Islam will only help ISIS recruit more murderous psychopaths.

Can we not all agree on at least these points?

One would have thought after the attack on the LGBT community in Orlando that the liberal mind set would have finally realized their tactics in an attempt to dispose of terroristic groups does not work with "love and hugs", but just conveys weakness.

The love and hugs are for after the war...

Some of our enemies probably do need to be killed. The difficult thing - which requires more patience and self-control - is not to create even more enemies than we kill.

your English is perfect, perfectly understood. so sorry for your country's loss.
your English is perfect, perfectly understood. so sorry for your country's loss.

Here in Tokyo we never have shootings, because nobody has guns. Yes, there was an incident a couple of years ago where some madman ran over tourists with a rented truck. But in general this is a far safer place to live.
In Tokyo, small children still play outside unattended, without their parents having to worry. At 5:30 p.m. a loudspeaker announcement asks that all the little children playing outside please come home.
Why do you think I am still here after so many years?

Yes, it can go on. This scene could be repeated every day.

Did Francois Allande just say that it was Nice's TURN to be struck by terrorists? Or was it just bad translation? If he really said that, what is he thinking: different cities take turns getting targeted by terrorists like different countries in EU take turns to presidency?

France had an emergency in place and the extension he proposed is not going to make matters any safer.

We need to find a way to stop this scourge. This cannot go on.

Great

Poaching this way does not work at altitude. As altitude increases, vapor pressure decreases and water boils at a lower temperature, and will never exceed that temperature. Where I live, that's 198.5F. Inevitably a post-soak simmer is required. So I just keep it simple and simmer from the beginning.

Four pounds of chicken overwhelms the other other ingredients. I added more of what I had to get something not too dry.

Finally, this recipe needs a lot of jazzing up to be interesting.
We used boneless skinless chicken beasts, and made the whole amount of sauce for about one pound of chicken. I served the extra sauce with rice. The meal was delicious, and we'll have it again.
